intro: Dopatrium angolense, commonly known as the Angola milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species known for their milky sap. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite and elliptical, while its flowers are clustered in terminal inflorescences. The showy, tubular flowers are usually pink or purple, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds.
